bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washinton.
In the Matter of the Application of Chung Him and Seid Yam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Chung Him and Seid Yam, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

The above matter having come on before the court on this date and the court having heretofore on this date entered its decree and judgment releasing and discharging the said petitioners, and each of them, from the custody of the respondent, and the respondent, through the United States District Attorney, having given notice in open court in open court of appeal of the respondent from the said judgment and decree, and having moved the court to fix the recognizance and bail for the release of the said petitioners and each of them, pending the adjudication of the said appeal, and the court being of the opinion that said recognizance and bail should be fixed at the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000.) each, it is therefore

ORDERED, that pending the said appeal the said petitioners,and each of them, may and shall be released from the custody of the respondent upon the furnishing by the petitioners,and each of them,of good and sufficient bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000) for each petitioner, such bond to be approved by the United States District Attorney.
DONE in open court this 6th day of December, 1920.
